title: AWS API Gateway Specialist
description:
**Our DevOps team is growing and to be able to continue delivering great result we welcome an AWS API Gateway Specialist that is not afraid of taking the lead and being a doer. To fit our agile team, you need to be a senior engineer with proven experience in Cloud computing platforms. As an agile AWS API Gateway Specialist, you will have a highly collaborate role and working closely with other agile delivery teams.**


### **Required Skills**


* Hands on Development experience working with APIs and API Gateway product.
* Advanced knowledge of the implementation of API service architectures (SOAP, REST) with one of the market-leading API management tools such as AWS API Gateway and/or Kong and/or WSO2 and/or Apigee, etc.
* Contribute to 3rd level support (troubleshooting) and support of incident, change, problem management processes in collaboration with clients, 2nd level support and providers.
* Knowledge of WebSocket APIs, REST, XML, JSON, SOA/Web services, Internet/network security standards (WS Security, OAUTH2.0 (incl. grant types and scopes), OpenID Connect, JWT, etc.).
* Comprehensive understanding of mobile, cloud, on-premise and hybrid solutions as well as containers and delivery platforms.
* Experience with terraform and lambda will be an added advantage


**Desired Skills**


* Design and implement gateway policies – e.g. for exposing APIs, automation of API ecosystem.
* Deploying cloud-native applications and monitoring and supporting a Kubernetes environment.
* In-depth knowledge of backend server components, APIs, and performance tuning.
* Technical knowledge in a PaaS, SaaS and IaaS environment.
* Engineering of API Gateway enhancements, e.g. self-services for DevOps, log integration, improvements for monitoring and capacity management.
* Engineer and execute infrastructure lifecycle tasks on our API Gateways.
* Experience with network protocols and technologies: TCP / IP, SMTP, FTP, HTTP, DNS, VPN, LDAP, Internet.
* Profound experience in HTTP, XML/XSD, JSON, SOAP, REST and the various Web Service standards (WS-\*).
* Experience as a developer of Web service-based integration scenarios, adopt at working with testing tools such as SoapUI, Postman, WebSocket utilities.
* Understand microservice patterns and concepts and how to apply them to problem solving.
* Experience of working in an agile organization.

title: BESS & EMS System Architect at Volvo Energy
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport and infrastructure solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**We shape the world we want to live in!**
------------------------------------------


Volvo Energy is our newest business area with the overarching purpose of accelerating electrification and driving circularity for a better tomorrow. With an agile approach and a can-do mindset, we actively work to ensure the acceleration of the electrification transformation every day in all that we do. As the Volvo Group, we are driving circularity in our industry forward in these important areas.

  

We are now looking for a new colleague to join our team!

 **Volvo Energy Digital & IT**  

Digital & IT is a function within Volvo Energy. We support our customers transition to a carbon-free world through great Digital solutions and experiences that enables customers to shift to fossil-free transport operations. We are comprised of different nationalities spread across the globe, united by our interest in technology and purpose of enabling green energy usage with our digital solutions. We truly care about the customer’s business in terms of up-time, safety and productivity.

**What you will do**
--------------------


In your role as a BESS System Architect, you will focus on our Energy Management Systems (EMS) that support the complex needs of our Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS) products in the rapidly evolving energy markets. You will support in establishing connectivity between the BESS units and its connected services, including local and cloud EMS functionality, including the digital twins that are the basis for our data-driven tools and decision engines. You’ll architect the environment around our IoT Edge devices, incl. connected vehicle chargers, sustainable energy generation and other devices enabling smart and connected energy management.

  

You’ll work with market interoperability between energy systems, encompassing standards like IEC 60870-5, 61850 and DNP-3 and make sure the IoT Edge solutions are designed to communicate accordingly. You will ensure reliable and cyber secure connectivity between edge components and the Volvo Energy EMS solution via MQTT/OPC-UA as defined by the Volvo Energy target architecture.

  

You will work closely together with several different, highly qualified, international teams to help design and build our solutions.

**Working at Volvo Energy is different**
----------------------------------------


Welcome to a close-knit team!

  

We see ourselves as a fast-paced company within the Volvo Group, supported by our many great colleagues, we have the best of both worlds! We believe that work should be fun, stimulating, challenging and rewarding, but also have a meaning and a purpose to the individual. Trust and Results are two guiding principles for how we work together, and we are here to make a difference!  

  

We are a small team that will grow with the business and therefore look for colleagues that thoroughly enjoy this entrepreneurial challenge, can hit the ground running and lead with passion, perform with purpose and transform with vision. Moreover, it is essential you have a strong ability to form trustful relationships to effectively work with partners - inside and outside of the Volvo Group – in a cross-functional manner.

 **Qualifications likely required to be successful**  

* Experience developing embedded systems like IoT edge computers (Linux/ARM based) for communication and control applications. Preferably related to energy management, electric grids or real estate site control.
* Knowledge in the areas of
* Energy management systems (EMS)
* Supervision and Control systems (e.g. SCADA)
* Protocols like Modbus, MQTT and OPC-UA
* Solid understanding of cyber security, data management and modern integration technologies
* Relevant university education: electrical engineering, industrial engineering, computer science, Data, Informatics or equivalent.
* Experience from Agile development and DevOps practices.
* Fluency in English, written and spoken.
**Ready for the next move?**
----------------------------


Are you excited to bring your skills and disruptive ideas to the table? We can’t wait to hear from you. Apply today!

  

Last application date: 18/10/2024

**Feel free to contact us if you have further questions**  

Axel Kullander, Head of Digital Products BMOT  

e-mail: axel.kullander@volvo.com  

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/axelkullander/

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Volvo Energy** lives and leads the change in accelerating Volvo Group’s electrification journey and driving circularity for a better tomorrow. We bring together people with who will work in a highly diverse, equal and inclusive global context with an entrepreneurial spirit where everyone is key and directly contributes to achieving our ambitions for wanted position: better for people – better for planet – better for business. Together – from individual success to collective significance!

title: Technical Marketing Automation Specialist
description:
We are on an exciting journey to develop the area within CRM and Customer Value Management to work more data-driven and are currently looking for a curious technical Marketing Automation Specialist with experience in CRM from a technical perspective to join our Martech Team. Are you who we are looking for?


About the job
As Marketing Automation Specialist with us, you will:

* Maintain marketing automation integration with CRM system and assist in the integration of additional platforms into the marketing automation software.
* Manage marketing automation efforts and processes, proactively researching and implementing the latest best practices, strategies, and industry standards
* Support essential marketing operations initiatives in the marketing automation platform such as managing the lead lifecycle, lead nurturing, segmentation, and data cleansing.
* Develop the marketing automation platform to support personalization requirements.
* Work with the broader setup for how we develop the customer’s relationship over time and how to implement the logic within the marketing automation platform from a technical perspective
* Plan and perform A/B testing to define and execute enhancements to productivity, conversion rates, programs/campaign ROI, and sales growth.


In this role, there will be a lot of development potential and you will create a large network within ICA Bank & ICA Insurance, as you will be expected to collaborate with different teams such as Marketing, Product, IT, Business to Consumer and Insurance.


Who are you?
In terms of experience, we are looking for:

* 2+ years of experience with the technical side of Marketing Automation.
* Experience with database management concepts and best practices.
* Experience configuring and implementing Marketing Automation tooling and how to integrate this with other systems.
* Experience with configuring targeted marketing campaigns (logged in state) through digital channels.
* Demonstrated experience working with configuration and management of a Marketing Automation platform.


It is advantageous if you have worked within a Bank or Insurance company, and if you have previous experience with Jira and/or MS DevOps. Experience of working in an agile organization and understanding of the agile way of working is also a merit.


We are looking for someone who has sharp analytical skills and likes to make things happen. It is easy for you to look up and see the big picture and you work in a structured way. You are confident in yourself and your skills and are happy to share your knowledge. Furthermore, you have a genuine interest and follow trends regarding Data & Analytics and you are passionate about working in a cooperative and agile environment.


What happens now?
Apply as soon as possible, as the selection will be done ongoing, but no later than October 30th, 2024. Questions about the position can be answered by the Recruiting Manager, Negar Zaerzadeh tel 0735262425. Questions about the recruitment process can be answered by the Recruiter, Bojana Mijocevic 076 695 15 33.


We are supposed to mirror our customers as well as the society and require employees with different competences. We strive at recruiting people with different backgrounds and value knowledge and experience that brings in. We value good conditions for a sustainable work life by have a good working environment and possibilities to constant evolution. If roles require it, you will need to undergo tests, background checks and drug testing before employment.


Learn more about what it is like to work at ICA.

title: DevSecOps Engineer
description:
**Stockholm, Malmö**
--------------------


**Sista ansökningsdag:** 3 november, 2024


Tyréns är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom samhällsbyggnad. Med 2000 specialister inom stadsutveckling, arkitektur och infrastruktur bygger vi samhällen som håller.
**Om tjänsten**

Som *DevSecOps Engineer* hos oss på Tyréns kommer du arbeta inom *Affärsstöd*. Affärsstöd består av totalt cirka 150 personer, specialiserade inom områdena IT, ekonomi, juridik, HR & lön, marknad, kommunikation, inköp, kvalitet, säkerhet, hållbarhet, kontor & fastighet och interna projekt.



Affärsstöd arbetar både strategiskt och operativt, med förvaltning och utveckling samt stöd och rådgivning. Affärsstöds syfte är att bidra till att förverkliga Tyréns affär: *Jobba med samhällsbyggnad med målet att skapa bättre förutsättningar för dagens och framtidens städer.*



Som DevSecOps Engineer hos oss på Tyréns får du en central roll i IT-organisationen, där du arbetar nära såväl utvecklings- som driftsteamen för att optimera och säkra Tyréns infrastruktur. Du kommer att bidra till både strategisk och operativ utveckling inom IT, där du driver automatisering, felsökning och säkerhetsintegration men också vidareutvecklar processer och rutiner.



I denna roll kommer du exempelvis jobba med att:


* Förena utvecklings- och driftsprocesser för att skapa en smidig och effektiv miljö
* Integrera säkerhetslösningar i samarbete med utvecklingsteamen
* Felsöka och åtgärda säkerhetsrisker, samt proaktivt arbeta med riskhantering och incidenthantering.
* Automatisera processer för att optimera systemutveckling och drift
* Övervaka och analysera loggar samt systemprestanda för att säkerställa stabilitet och säkerhet.
* Driftsätta och konfigurera hård- och mjukvara på server och klientnivå


Du blir en del ett sammansvetsat och erfaret team som jobbar med allt från avancerad nätverksinfrastruktur till support. Du kommer ha alla möjligheter att forma och påverka såväl innehåll i rollen som vidareutvecklingen av Tyréns IT-landskap, arbetssätt och processer.

Möjliga placeringsorter är Stockholm eller Malmö. Vi tillämpar en hybrid arbetsmodell där du delvis kan arbeta på distans.


**Vi erbjuder**


* Fantastiska kollegor och många specialister inom våra olika kompetensområden
* En värderingsdriven kultur där *Connect*, *Create* & *Challenge* är våra ledord
* En stimulerande arbetsmiljö i våra lokaler med möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån del av din arbetstid
* Möjlighet att jobba med innovationsprojekt
* Kompetensutveckling anpassad efter dig
* Sociala aktiviteter, både på och efter ordinarie arbetstid
* Fast månadslön
* Extra lediga dagar utöver dina semesterdagar, vi är t.ex. alltid lediga med lön dagarna mellan jul och nyår
* Flertalet personalförmåner via vår förmånsportal
* Kollektivavtal som vi tecknat med Innovationsföretagen (Almega)

  


**Vi söker**



För att lyckas och trivas i rollen anser vi att du bör ha:


* Erfarenhet av scriptspråk som exempelvis Python, Powershell och/eller Bash
* Erfarenhet av databasadministration, främst inom MS SQL
* Goda kunskaper inom systemutvecklingsområdet
* Erfarenhet av IT-infrastruktur i större organisationer
* Erfarenhet av serverdrift i Linux och Windows
* Goda kunskaper inom Microsoft Entra, Azure, MS365
* Goda kunskaper inom IT-säkerhet
* Erfarenhet av DevOps (metodik, verktyg, processer)


Meriterande är erfarenhet/kunskap inom:
* Administration av databaser
* Systemkonfiguration
* Certifieringar inom IT-området
* Erfarenhet av AWS och/eller GCP


Personliga egenskaper vi tror passar rollen och vår företagskultur:
* God förmåga att utmana nuläget
* Lösningsorienterad och självgående
* Tar egna initiativ för att utveckla både dig själv och organisationen.
* Duktig på att skapa samarbete med personer på olika nivåer och är hjälpsam, prestigelös och lyhörd


För denna tjänst ser vi att du hanterar det svenska och engelska språket i både tal och skrift för att kunna tillmötesgå våra kunder och kollegors behov.
**Ansöka**



Du är varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Personligt brev är inte ett krav hos oss, men kommer naturligtvis läsas om det bifogas.



Vi rekryterar löpande, så skicka gärna din ansökan redan idag då tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.



Med hänvisning till GDPR tar vi inte emot ansökningar per mejl utan hanterar enbart ansökningar som kommer in via ansökningslänken.


**OBS!** *I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med IDG Recruitment. Vi ber dig därför att skicka in din ansökan direkt till dem. För att komma till annonsen på deras hemsida klickar du* *här**.*


**Kontakt**



Vill du veta mer om tjänsten eller har frågor? Då är du välkommen att kontakta:



Alexandra Tihinen  

Rekryteringskonsult på IDG Recruitment
  

Mejl: alexandra.tihinen@foundryco.com  

Telefon: 070-447 92 24


Tyréns är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom samhällsbyggnad. I samspel med kunder och partners skapar vi hållbara lösningar inom stadsutveckling och infrastruktur. Vi har 3 000 medarbetare och verksamhet i Sverige, England, Estland, Litauen, Polen och Bulgarien. Tyréns är stiftelseägt och vår ägandeform gör det möjligt för oss att satsa målmedvetet på forskning och utveckling inom samhällsbyggnadsområdet. Vi drivs av nyfikenhet och har ett nära samarbete med universitet och högskolor.

title: Solutions Architect Enterprise, AWS Sweden
description:
* Background in Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, Data Engineering or DevOps across industries.
* Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience
* Experience in managing complex sales processes with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product and technical challenges
* English business level communication skills written and verbal


Are you passionate about cloud technology and helping customers innovate?
  
Join our AWS Solutions Architecture team in Sweden and empower large enterprises across industries to innovate at speed and scale with cloud technologies.
  
  

Solutions Architects work hand in hand with AWS customers to help them make the most of the Cloud. They are at the crossroads of business and technology and engage with organizations at all stages of cloud adoption. Solutions Architects are responsible for creating and presenting technical content and sharing best practices.
  
They work to understand the customer's business needs and give prescriptive guidance on how to create business value with technology. They help customer's validate their initiatives from ideation to proof of concept. Solutions Architects lead activities such as architecture reviews, white-boarding sessions, demos and technical workshops. They collaborate with other teams such as account management, professional services, Industry experts, support, service teams and the AWS partner ecosystem.
  
Amongst others you will be part of design and building reference architectures, proof of concepts and deploy production workloads on AWS. Provide thought leadership and recommendations on cloud architecture, migration, modernization and operation. Build strong technical relationships acting as the voice of the customer internally to influence AWS service roadmaps.
  
  

Come build the future with us.
  
  

AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
  
  

About the team
  
The Solutions Architecture team is a diverse group of technologists from a variety of backgrounds. Practical knowledge of the AWS platform is desired but not required, provided you have a sound technical foundation and a desire to learn. You will have the support to grow your expertise. Every day you will learn something new from your customers, your peers and your own experiments. At AWS you will be encouraged and rewarded for doing what is right for the long-term success of the customer. We value your passion to discover, invent and build on behalf of customers.
  
  

Diverse Experiences
  
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
  
Why AWS?
  
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
  
  

Inclusive Team Culture
  
Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
  
  

Mentorship & Career Growth
  
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
  
  

Work/Life Balance
  
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
  
  

* Prior domain experience in enterprise cloud adoption and operating production workloads on AWS
* Knowledge of cloud native design patterns, DevOps practices and AWS services
* Experience with or understanding of common enterprise regulations, security and compliance standards
* Public speaking experience or passion for creating technical content


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

title: Senior Architect
description:
**Grow with us**
----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

The world is changing, and so are we. As part of our oneRAN journey, we are evolving our production system and need your expertise to help us through this transformation. A world-class Continuous Integration (CI), Continuous Delivery and Deployment (CDD) system, using state-of-the-art technology, is essential for delivering high-quality products to our customers at a high pace.  

If you are passionate about production, testing, CI/CDD, cloud technologies, and want to be contribute and be part of product development journeys such as vDU2.0, NG-OLLS and 6G, and join a senior technical leadership team that always learn, teach, collaborate, and lead, we encourage you to apply!

 **What you will do:**

  

As a CI/CD Architect, you’ll join a highly skilled team within the RAN Production System unit. This team leads and drives key responsibilities, including:  

* Developing the Production System Strategy and sub-strategies.
* Defining and leading the CI/CD flow strategy.
* Aligning production system strategy with other BNEW strategies, such as Test Strategy.
* Designing, implementing, and managing CI/CD pipelines.
* Proposing and influencing product architecture requirements for continuous integration and deployment in operator networks.
* Reducing RAN product development lead time and optimizing workflow through interaction with program managers
* Proposing new CI/CD methodologies and sharing insights within Ericsson’s CI/CD community.
* Driving innovation, such as data-driven development, optimize flow and test efficiency.
* Ensuring that new innovations in CI/CD are patented.
  

This role involves close collaboration with PEUs within EUIR, as well as EU Hardware and EU Cloud RAN in BNEW R&D. Much of the work will be focused on early-phase product and production programs.

 **The skills you bring:**

  

* Strong background in DevOps practices and automation  

	+ Proven track record of implementing CI/CD solutions
	+ Experience enhancing software development and release processes for efficiency, scalability, and reliability
	+ Ability to drive strategy and results through collaboration
	+ Experience working with stakeholders to identify and implement production system improvements
	+ Knowledge of cloud technologies
	+ Knowledge of ML/ AI is a plus
  

If you’re ready to make an impact and lead the next phase of CI/CD innovation, we’d love to hear from you!

Last date to apply : 7th October 2024

  

Note: *Vetting including references and relevant background screening will be conducted for final candidates.*

 **What happens once you apply?**

  

Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

  

We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.

  

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. title: CI and CD architect
description:
**Grow with us**
----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

The world is changing, and so are we. As part of our oneRAN journey, we are evolving our production system and need your expertise to help us through this transformation. A world-class Continuous Integration (CI), Continuous Delivery and Deployment (CDD) system, using state-of-the-art technology, is essential for delivering high-quality products to our customers at a high pace.


If you are passionate about production, testing, CI/CDD, cloud technologies, and want to be contribute and be part of product development journeys such as vDU2.0, NG-OLLS and 6G, and join a senior technical leadership team that always learn, teach, collaborate, and lead, we encourage you to apply!

 **What You’ll Do:**

  

As a CI/CD Architect, you’ll join a highly skilled team within the RAN Production System unit. This team leads and drives key responsibilities, including:

* Understanding the Production System Strategy and sub-strategies.
* Understanding the CI/CD flow strategy
* Aligning production system strategy with other BNEW strategies, such as Test Strategy
* Implementing, and managing CI/CD pipelines
* Proposing product architecture requirements for continuous integration and deployment in operator networks.
* Reducing RAN product development lead time and optimizing workflow through interaction with program managers
* Proposing new CI/CD methodologies and sharing insights within Ericsson’s CI/CD community.
* Driving innovation, such as data-driven development, optimize flow and test efficiency.

  

This role involves close collaboration with PEUs within EUIR, as well as EU Hardware and EU Cloud RAN in BNEW R&D. Much of the work will be focused on early-phase product and production programs.

 **What You’ll Bring:**

  

* Good background in DevOps practices and automation
* Proven track record of implementing CI/CD solutions
* Experience enhancing software development and release processes for efficiency, scalability, and reliability
* Interested to drive strategy and results through collaboration
* Experience working with stakeholders to identify and implement production system improvements
* Knowledge of cloud technologies is a plus
* Knowledge of ML/ AI is a plus


If you’re ready to make an impact and lead the next phase of CI/CD improvement and innovation, we’d love to hear from you!

  

 Last date to apply : 7th October 2024

  

Note: *Vetting including references and relevant background screening will be conducted for final candidates.*

 **What happens once you apply?**

  

Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

  

We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.

  

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.

 **Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

**Primary Recruiter:** Versha Sharma

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
Role DevOps Cloud Engineer – Platform
 



 Location Stockholm Sweden
 



 Years of Experience Min. 6+ Years
 



 Type of Hiring Permanent
 



 Onsite/Offsite Hybrid Remote. 3 Days Work form Office, 2 Days Remote.
 



 Start/ End Date Immediate
 







 only EU/ Swedish Nationals.
 







 Job Description:
 



 We know that many different names are given to this role in other companies, and that the candidate experience likely spans a variety of areas including software development, cloud and traditional infrastructure. It is likely that in the past the candidate has had titles like DevOps, infrastructure, software, cloud or site reliability -engineer/architect.
 



 • Bring best practices from DevOps and site reliability engineering disciplines to industrial technology while building and improving the tooling needed to support this.
 



 • Design, test and deploy infrastructure to operate a modern factory producing large amounts of data and connected batteries daily using infrastructure as code.
 



 • Collaborate with software engineers to develop automation solutions for how we safely test and deploy code on anything from battery packs to cloud to factory equipment.
 



 • Work to develop and help to document client’s processes around infrastructure and software deployment, best practices and ways of working.
 



 • Work with the Security team to continuously test, monitor, and improve the security of our infrastructure.
 



 • Work with our IT department to help build out the right network architecture and deployment solutions for 3rd party software we need.
 



 • Improve and build the ML/AI Platform leveraging the data available from all our factories
 



 • Collaborate with a cross-functional group of experts across the company to make sure we build the right things together for the right reasons and learn how electrical batteries are designed, developed, and manufactured from cradle to grave
 



 • Keep up with the state of the art in infrastructure, “everything as a software,” virtualization, CI/CD frameworks, cross-platform software development, engineering processes, as well as develop more domain knowledge in related areas (among others, automation, battery manufacturing and connectivity)
 



 • Help us build a great team and make client a great place to work!
 







 Skills & Requirements
 



 • Deploying and managing infrastructure in the cloud (AWS, GCP or Azure) using infrastructure as code (ideally Terraform)
 



 • Developing and managing highly automated continuous integration and deployment pipelines and helping developers increase their productivity
 



 • Working with distributed systems, microservices, load balancing, etc.
 



 • Working with virtualization, containerization, Kubernetes and related technologies
 



 • Programming skills in at least one language (ideally Go or Python) and desire to learn more.
 



 • Good communication skills, ability to Get Stuff Done, and a learning mindset
 



 • Passion for solving problems with technology in simple yet innovative ways especially with open-source software
 



 • Qualities that we cherish are flexibility, sense of quality, friendliness, motivation to take on new challenges, grit and a sense of humour.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
At Greenely, we’re pioneering Europe's energy transition by making energy consumption smarter and household energy bills lower. We’re looking for a skilled DevOps Engineer to join us on this ambitious journey, driving innovation in infrastructure and automation to support our growing platform. Your work will directly contribute to building a greener future by enhancing the technology behind our energy-saving solutions.
   

  

 As part of our mission, we are currently migrating from EC2-based compute to ECS, optimizing our infrastructure, and improving resilience. We're looking for someone with the experience and vision to help lead this transformation.
   

  

**Your daily work includes:**
* Designing, building, and maintaining platform components in AWS to support our development infrastructure.
* Optimizing infrastructure provisioning through Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) practices using Terraform, ensuring robust monitoring and alerting.
* Troubleshooting complex production issues alongside cross-functional teams, ensuring high uptime and reliability.
* Leading on-call incident response and actively participating in service restoration when needed.
* Streamlining our CI/CD pipelines and automating deployment processes for rapid, reliable releases.
* Empowering the engineering team with automation solutions that accelerate development.


**What you'll need to succeed:**
* Cloud Expertise: Hands-on experience with AWS services (EKS, ECS, S3, RDS, Route53) and deep knowledge of scaling cloud environments.
* Backend Development: Proficiency in Python-based frameworks and microservices architectures.
* Containerization: Expertise in deploying containerized applications using Kubernetes and Docker, along with experience in migrating services to container orchestration tools like EKS and ECS.
* Database Management: Proven experience with relational databases like Postgres/MySQL, as well as NoSQL solutions like MongoDB/DynamoDB.
* CI/CD Mastery: Solid experience in building automated pipelines for testing and deployment, and working with CI/CD tools like GitHub Actions, Travis CI, or CircleCI.
* Security and Monitoring: A strong foundation in Linux systems, security best practices, and experience building monitoring and alerting systems with tools like DataDog or NewRelic.


**We’ll be really impressed if you:**
* Are passionate about automation and have a proven ability to reduce manual tasks through efficient, scalable solutions.
* Have experience working with Terraform to manage complex cloud environments.
* Can troubleshoot networking, security, and system performance issues with ease.
* Have a deep understanding of DevOps principles and a passion for improving development processes.
* Are a proactive problem solver with excellent communication skills, capable of explaining technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment and can juggle multiple tasks while maintaining high quality.


 We place high emphasis on your interpersonal abilities at Greenely. Greenely's strength is drawn from team members who don't just do their job, but who actively shape the way we work. We seek individuals who naturally take charge, own their responsibilities with pride, and consistently hold themselves accountable. We're searching for someone who can gracefully navigate change, who sees challenges not as obstacles but as puzzles waiting to be solved, and who values the collective success of the team.
   

  

**What we can offer you** 
 🏢👩‍💻
 **:**
* Flexibility: We are an office-first company that values in-person collaboration, offering flexible work arrangements to support your work-life balance. Our vibrant office is conveniently located in the heart of Stockholm at Vasagatan 40.
* Growth: Elevate your career with opportunities for skill development, challenging projects, and advancement within our forward-thinking organization.
* Influence and Impact: Your voice matters. Shape the future of energy by contributing your ideas, expertise, and playing a key role in decision-making.
* Innovative Environment: Thrive in an ever-changing industry, working on cutting-edge projects and staying ahead of the curve in a dynamic and pioneering work atmosphere.


**About Greenely**
 Greenely aims to create the best customer experience for the modern energy consumer through technology. Greenely's integrated mobile application enables households to optimize their energy consumption, reduce their electricity costs, and participate in grid balancing services. By connecting various energy assets in the home, Greenely's platform allows consumers to manage their energy usage efficiently while contributing to the stability of the power system. Greenely's solution addresses the challenges of the modern energy landscape and promotes a more efficient, sustainable, and reliable power system. By providing consumers with savings and new revenue streams, Greenely drives the transition to a cleaner and more resilient energy system.
   

  

 WE ARE
 **bold and push the limit.**
 WE BELIEVE THAT
 **f** 
****ast is better than slow.****
 WE
 **t** 
******hink like owners.******
 WE
 ****lead with knowledge.****

title: ALTEN Stockholm söker DevOps-ingenjörer
description:
**Är du en skicklig DevOps-ingenjör med passion för molnteknologi? Ta nästa steg i din karriär hos ALTEN!** 




  





**Vi söker talangfulla DevOps-ingenjörer till vårt team i Stockholm** 




 Vill du arbeta med modern teknologi och bidra till en hållbar framtid? Hos oss på ALTEN får du möjlighet att vara en del av en dynamisk, innovativ och internationell miljö tillsammans med kunniga och stöttande kollegor. Låter det intressant? Ansök idag!
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Som DevOps-ingenjör hos oss kommer du att:
 


* Vara en del av vårt fantastiska internationella konsultteam med expertis inom IT.
* Arbeta med varierande uppgifter i både nationella och internationella projekt hos våra världsledande kunder.
* Använda din kommunikativa och lyhörda natur för att främja gott samarbete.
* Dra nytta av din bakgrund inom utveckling och din passion för DevOps.
* Möjligtvis agera som teknisk konsult eller rådgivare.



  





**Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av:** 



* Minst 3 års praktisk erfarenhet av DevOps
* Programmeringsspråk som Python, GoLang eller Bash
* Molnplattformar som AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud Platform
* CI/CD-processer
* Containerteknologier som Docker eller Kubernetes
* Verktyg som Git, Jenkins eller Gerrit
* Atlassian-produkter



  





**Meriterande är:** 



* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila miljöer
* Svenska språkkunskaper



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På ALTEN värdesätter vi varje individ i byggandet av morgondagens värld. Vi stödjer våra kunders projekt och ger våra medarbetare möjlighet att nå sin fulla potential genom att erbjuda:
 



  




* **Tekniska utmaningar** 
 och meningsfulla möjligheter
* En
 **inspirerande gemenskap** 
 och chansen att bidra till en hållbar framtid
* **Coachande ledarskap** 
 där våra ledare vägleder dig i rätt riktning
* **Personligt anpassade utbildningsmöjligheter** 
 via din individuella utbildningsbudget, användbar på vår interna ALTEN Academy eller externa kurser



  





**Om ALTEN** 




 ALTEN är ett av Europas största konsultbolag inom teknik, IT och Life Sciences med över 57 000 anställda i mer än 30 länder. Med 1 400 engagerade kollegor i Sverige, från Lund i söder till Skellefteå i norr, är vi en global aktör med lokal närvaro. Våra ingenjörer driver komplexa och högteknologiska projekt genom hela produktutvecklingskedjan hos några av de mest prestigefyllda företagen inom fordonsindustrin, flyg- och försvarsindustrin, energi, tillverkning, offentlig sektor och Life Sciences.

title: Junior Cloud Developer
description:

 Ett ledande, Skandinaviskt företag inom IoT-tjänster med över 20 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med företag världen över söker dig som drivs av komplex datahantering som arbetat med stora dataflöden.

 IT

 Full time

 Staffing
